headline: AppLovin (NasdaqGS:APP) Announces Appointment Of Maynard Webb To The Board
summary: AppLovin (NasdaqGS:APP) experienced a 12% price move last week amid significant market turbulence, fueled by ongoing legal issues and strategic developments. The recent filing of a securities class action lawsuit against AppLovin could affect investor perception, yet the market’s overall upward trajectory, with a 4% gain over the same period, suggests broader sentiment also played a role. Meanwhile, amid mixed market performance, including Intel's decline and Tesla's significant rise,...

headline: Google ad strength, T-Mobile falls, Pony AI & Tencent partnership
summary: As part of today's Market Minute, Brad Smith outlines the top stories on Wall Street in just 60 seconds. Internet stocks, including AppLovin (APP), Pinterest (PINS), and Reddit (RDDT), are gaining after Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) earnings showed ad revenue strength. T-Mobile (TMUS) stock plunges on the company's weak new subscriber count. Pony AI (PONY) partners with Tencent (TCEHY) on robotaxis. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Reddit, Meta, and Pinterest Stocks Rise. How Alphabet’s Earnings Are Giving Them a Boost.
summary: Shares of social media companies like Instagram and Facebook owner  Meta Platforms Reddit  and Pinterest were rising Friday on the back of strong earnings from  Alphabet  The advertising heavyweight’s latest financials were a reassuring sign for companies that rely on digital ad revenue.  The Google and YouTube parent’s first-quarter print on Thursday highlighted growth in its advertising business.  Alphabet also cited strength in its YouTube ads business, which rose to $8.9 billion from $8.1 billion in 2024.

headline: Tradr Launches Leveraged ETFs on APP and QBTS
summary: Tradr ETFs, a provider of ETFs designed for sophisticated investors and professional traders, today announced the launch of two new single stock leveraged ETFs: APPX and QBTX. These funds aim to deliver twice (200%) the daily performance of the common stock of innovative companies with exposure to advertising technology and quantum computing. The new ETFs include:
